task.title: Installing DITA-OT via Homebrew
task.shortdesc: An alternative installation method can be used to install DITA-OT via , one of the most popular open-source package managers on macOS and Linux.

prereq.p: The steps below assume you have already installed according to the instructions at brew.sh.
prereq.note:
Verify that your begins with the bin subfolder of the Homebrew installation directory Homebrew’s default installation location depends on the operating system architecture:
/usr/local on macOS Intel
/opt/homebrew on macOS ARM
/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew on Linux
to ensure that Homebrew-installed software takes precedence over any programs of the same name elsewhere on the system.

step.cmd: Update Homebrew to make sure the latest package formulas are available on your system:

stepresult.p: Homebrew responds with a list of any new or updated formulæ.

step.cmd: Check the version of DITA-OT that is available from Homebrew:

stepxmp.codeblock: $ brew info dita-ot dita-ot: stable DITA Open Toolkit is an implementation of the OASIS DITA specification https://www.dita-ot.org/ /opt/homebrew/Cellar/dita-ot/ (number of files, package size) * Poured from bottle using the formulae.brew.sh API on YYYY-MM-DD at hh:mm:ss From: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/blob/master/Formula/dita-ot.rb License: Apache-2.0 ==> Dependencies Required: openjdk ✔

stepresult.p: The version of the DITA-OT formula is shown, along with basic information on the package.

Homebrew will automatically download the latest version of the toolkit, install it in a subfolder of the local package Cellar and symlink the dita command to the bin subfolder of the Homebrew installation directory.
The response confirms that the system will use the Homebrew-installed version of DITA-OT.

step.stepresult: The DITA-OT version number appears on the console.

result.p: You can now run the dita command to transform DITA content.
